story.synopsys: In the year 3669, amidst the technologically advanced world of Shadow, a murder has sent shockwaves through this sprawling metropolis. The city, known for its towering skyscrapers, neon-lit streets, and hovercraft-filled skies, has always been a hub of innovation and endless possibilities. However, this futuristic paradise has become the backdrop of a sinister tale as the lifeless body of a prominent scientist is discovered in his high-tech laboratory. As the sun sets over the glittering skyline, the city's elite detectives race against time to unravel the web of secrets, hidden motives, and elusive suspects. Mysterious holographic clues, advanced surveillance systems, and a new generation of robotic witnesses provide both aid and obfuscation in this gripping murder mystery, marking a sinister turn for Shadow's once idyllic reputation. With the future of justice hanging in the balance, the investigators delve into the darkest corners of this seemingly utopian city, determined to restore order and unmask the heart of this enigmatic crime.

background.backstory: Raven Shadowheart was born and raised in the mysterious city of Shadowhaven, known for its dark and enigmatic aura. Growing up surrounded by secrets and intrigue, Raven developed a keen eye for shadows and a deep understanding of the art of deduction. As a young child, Raven witnessed a heinous crime that remained unsolved, sparking a lifelong obsession with solving mysteries. After years of training in the ancient Shadow arts, Raven became a renowned detective, feared by criminals and revered by the citizens of Shadowhaven. With an uncanny ability to blend into the shadows and an insatiable thirst for justice, Raven is determined to uncover the truth behind the murder of the victim.
background.bias: As a Master Detective, Raven maintains an impartial stance in all investigations. However, due to the dark nature of Shadowhaven and its hidden underworld, Raven's bias leans towards unmasking any conspiracies or secret societies that may be involved in the murder of the victim.
